column4: Greetings all :) does anyone know of a good guide to mounting local HD from a LiveCD? or perhaps know the mount options off hand?
what version are you using?
of Ubuntu? 6.06
yes, what was your problem?
trying to mount my local HD from a liveCD... how do I list my local HD partitions... I'm not sure about the name... thought it was sda8 but mount is complaining...
go to your system, administration, disk mangaer, got that far yet?
device manager or disks?
disks to mount it.

for example, create you a folder on your desktop call mount, then within disks manager find your drive that you want to mount. then within the options select mount point, mount it to /home/yourname/Desktop/mount
then mount it, easy.
attempting now...
thanx it seems to be working ;)
good job agliv so what are you needing to do?
that's a very long story... but at the moment I want to burn some data from the HD to a CD... currently trying to get k3b installed properly ;)
k3b is alright, gnomebaker's good too
I like k3b or nero4linux best... just have to work out all the dependencies ;)
never tried nero4linux, do you know if that supports lightscribe?
I'm sorry, I don't... have more expierence with k3b...
i use k3b because it is sorta integrated with amarok.
never heard of amarok...
its a music player, the best out there, if you like k3b, you'll love amarok, give it a try, but there are like 100mb of dependencies if you don't already have kde base
my sound card isn't working yet so I haven't looked into music players for my system...
